description: a(n) = number of (s(0), s(1), ..., s(n)) such that s(i) is an integer, s(0) = 0, |s(1)| = 1, |s(i) - s(i-1)| <= 1 for i >= 2, s(n) = 1. Also a(n) = T(n,n-1), where T is the array defined in A025177.
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..200
formula: Sum_{k=0..floor(n/2)} binomial(n, 2*k)*binomial(2*k+1, k+1). E.g.f.: exp(x)*(BesselI(0, 2*x)+BesselI(2, 2*x)). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Jan 01 2004G.f.: ((1-x)^2-(1-x)sqrt(1-2x-3x^2))/(2x*sqrt(1-2x-3x^2)); a(n+1)=sum{k=0..n, C(n, k)C(k+1, k/2+1)(1+(-1)^k)/2}; - _Paul Barry_, Sep 17 2005Conjecture: (n+1)*a(n) +(-3*n+1)*a(n-1) +(-n-5)*a(n-2) +3*(n-3)*a(n-3)=0. - _R. J. Mathar_, Nov 26 2012a(n) ~ 3^(n-1/2) / sqrt(Pi*n). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Feb 13 2014
author: _Clark Kimberling_
